abstracts.cdata!:
The Emergency Recovery and Disaster
            Management Project, Second Phase, will strengthen the
            ability to direct disaster management agencies, and enhance
            their capacity to mitigate adversity, concerning particular
            disasters such as floods, landslides, storm surges, and
            hurricanes in Grenada. The components will: 1) finance the
            National Emergency Relief Organization's strengthening,
            and, develop a country-wide early warning, and emergency
            communications system, through the implementation of shelter
            programs, and capacity building measures for the Ministry of
            Communications, Works and Public Utilities. Equipment will
            be financed, as well as comprehensive training, and public
            awareness programs to address disaster management; 2)
            implement preventive physical mitigation, responsive to
            adversities resulting from Hurricane Lenny (November 1999),
            which will include sea defenses in protection against storm
            surges; rehabilitation of exposed road sections;
            feasibility, and design of a prioritized sea defense
            investment program; drainage and flood control through
            engineering design for flood-prone areas; and, river
            training, and slope protection civil works; and, 3) finance
            project management, by appointing a Project Coordinator, an
            assistant Project Coordinator, Procurement Officer,
            Accountant, and Administrative Assistant. Office equipment,
            and technical, and financial audits will also be funded.
